FINRA_EMPLOYMENT: MERRILL LYNCH, PIERCE, FENNER & SMITH INCORPORATED (7691)

DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "COMPLAINANT ALLEGES THAT AZIZ WAS NOT SERIES 3 REGISTERED YET HE HANDLED THE ACCOUNT, THAT HE BREACHED HIS FIDUCIARY DUTY TO COMPLAINANT AND THAT HE INDUCED HER TO BORROW MONEY TO CONTINUE TRADING. DAMAGES SOUGHT WERE AMENDED TO $76,000.00.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$76,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$39,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "92-5047",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE [CUSTOMERS] OWNED INTERNATIONAL BUSINESSES AND WERE SOPHISTICATED CURRENTY INVESTORS. THEY OPEND A COMMODITIES ACCOUNT WITH ME THAT WAS APPROVED BY THE MERRILL LYNCH COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT. THERI TRADES WERE PRIMARILY UNSOLICITED. WHEN THE RUSSIAN COUP OCCURRED THEIR CURRENCY HEDGE POSITIONS SUFFERED LOSSES. AFTER THE COMPLAINT WAS FILED, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE FIRM (MERRILL LYNCH) HAD FAILED TO PROPERLY REGISTER ME AND MY BRANCH MANAGER AS CA'S EVEN THOUGH WE HAD PASSED ALL APPROPRIATE TESTS. AS A RESULT, THE FIRM AGREED TO SETTLE THE CLAIM FOR $39,000. I WAS NEVER ASKED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE SETTLEMENT."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMERS ALLEGED UNSUITABILITY AND UNAUTHORIAZED TRADING IN REGARD TO THEIR ACCOUNT.  DAMAGES ALLEGED: $240,000 CAPITAL LOSSES ($140,000 NET LOSSES).",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$240,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$75,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "AS AN ACCOMMODATION TO THE CUSTOMER AND TO AVOID THE EXPENSE OF CONTINUED LITIGATION, MERRILL LYNCH SETTLED THIS COMPLAINT FOR $75,000. THE [CUSTOMERS] WERE SOPHISTICATED AND EXPERIENCED INVESTORS WHO ALSO MAINTAINED ACCOUNTS WITH OTHER FIRMS.  THEY HAD AN ASSET POWER (WRAPPED) ACCOUNT, WHICH WAS DISCOUNTED.  I SPOKE WITH THE CLIENT CONSTANTLY AND SHE AUTHORIZED EVERY TRADE.  ALL RECOMMENDATIONS WERE CONSISTENT WITH THEIR INVESTMENT EXPERIENCE AND OBJECTIVES.  THE MAJORITY WERE FIRM RECOMMENDED STOCKS.  ON MANY OCCASIONS, [CUSTOMER] PLACED UNSOLITATED TRADES, SOME OF WHICH APPEAR TO FORM THE BASIS OF THEIR COMPLAINT."
}
